page.title: 09GAITSGILL FARM
page.content: Gaitsgill Farm is a tenanted farm which is rented from the church commissioners. It has a total acreage of 126 acres. At the moment it is a beef farm, with Hereford bullocks and Hereford Cross cows with Charolais calves at foot. In July 1985 the farmer might go back to milking cows again. If so, there will be between 50 and 60 Ayrshire cows along with about 6 or 7 Jersey cows. The farmer does not employ any labour; he only gets help from his family at nights and weekends. When it comes to silaging, ploughing, hedge-cutting or combining the farmer gets help from an agricultural contractor because he can do the job more easily than the farmer can and he has the the right machinery to do the job.
